ComicInfo.Characters: Un-named man (death),Mike Mason (villain, thief),Charlie Peace (villain, fence),un-named woman (villain, sorceress, the man's wife),Anothor (villain, evil spirit),Abaddon (villain, evil spirit),Nixwit (villain, evil spirit)
ComicInfo.Title: The Man Who Stole Eternity; Frankenstein, Book II: Chapter One; A Coffin for Captain Cutlass; The Heap Meets the Horror Master!; Gruesome Crewcut!; The Love Witch
ComicInfo.Summary:
The Man Who Stole Eternity: A thief decides to strike it really big and knock over the Magic Museum, even though the theft earlier of some pearls led to a strange curse being placed upon him by a sorceress. She later demands that he steal a special elixir or be tormented by wicked spirits for the rest of his life. This he does, but the outcome is not what he expected!
Frankenstein, Book II: Chapter One: In the Arctic, the monster finds the frozen corpse of his hated creator and takes it back to the Frankenstein castle in Germany. He plans on reviving Frankenstein as an undead abomination to get revenge for his creator creating him as an undead abomination. During the process, the castle is destroyed by an electrical explosion. After the dust settles, Dr.Frankenstein lives again as a monster like his creation. He wanders out into the nearby village and is destroyed by the villagers.
A Coffin for Captain Cutlass: Don Miguel, an admiral for the King of Spain, wants revenge on the Caribbean pirate Captain Cutlass and unleashes a horrific demonic creature on him that has been sealed in a coffin. Cutlass manages to turn the tables on the admiral and sends the creature after him and his men.
The Heap Meets the Horror Master!: The Horror Master uses black arts to resurrect the rotting corpses of some of history's most evil people (Adolf Hitler, Genghis Khan, Caligula, Rasputin etc). The Heap puts a stop to all of this.
Gruesome Crewcut!: A young boy refuses to cut his hair like his father asks. He runs away into the woods at night. There a bald ghoul who wants hair, scalps the kid.
The Love Witch: Burnick who's known as the Love Witch, uses her powers to burn and destroy people. She finally meets her match in the form of Morpheus, the god of sleep and dreams.
ComicInfo.Writer: Gardner Fox,Sean Todd,Chuck McNaughton,Ross Andru,Chic Stone,Marv Wolfman
ComicInfo.Penciller: Bill Everett,Sean Todd,Serg Moren,Ross Andru,Chic Stone,Jack Purcell
ComicInfo.Inker: Bill Everett,Dan Adkins,Serg Moren,Mike Esposito,Chic Stone,Jack Purcell
